image.altText: Anthony Albanese plane

props.synopsis: The historic decision foreshadowed last month has now become a reality, as Australia moves with Canada and the United Kingdom to join the growing list of countries to recognise Palestinian sovereignty.

title.children: Australia formally recognises state of Palestine

image.altText: A man waves a Palestinian flag in front of police officers at Parliament House.

props.synopsis: While the Israel Defense Forces bomb Gaza and bulldoze the West Bank for settlements, moves to recognise Palestine in pursuit of a two-state solution may appear like something of a sick joke.Â

title.children: As Israel bombs Gaza, recognition of Palestine is a last-gasp effort

image.altText: Image of Charlie Kirk raising fist as crowds wait for his memorial service to begin.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump is expected to address the thousands of people who have gathered to attend the memorial to right-wing activist Charlie Kirk, who was shot and killed at a Utah university event.

title.children: Trump to speak as thousands gather for Charlie Kirk memorial

image.altText: An older man and woman sit beside side by side inside with serious facial expressions. The woman holds a small brown dog.

props.synopsis: Older Australians entering the aged care system will have to pay for "non-clinical" services such as showers and help with medication under wide-ranging changes taking effect in November.

title.children: Older Australians to pay up to $50/hour for personal care like showers

image.altText: Anthony Albanese close up, with Chris Bowen in background.

props.synopsis: The problem with an emissions reduction target is that its mere existence implies it is achievable and that if we do achieve it, we will be fine. The truth is more complex.

title.children: Net zero by 2035 means sacrificing farmland to build forests

image.altText: Sarah Kopp composite (2)

props.synopsis: Sarah Kopp's life was up-ended when a charismatic teacher twice her age started grooming her. Then they married and had children. When she sought justice 20 years on, she faced an impossible choice.

title.children: Groomed at 15, married at 21. How Sarah finally exposed her predatory teacher

image.altText: An AI logo is shown in a conference

props.synopsis: It's estimated 30,000 people are working in the AI industry in Australia, and fanfare is growing with start-ups tapping into billions of dollars of venture capital. Yet there are concerns about hype and a lack of regulation.

title.children: Tech bubble or 'fourth industrial revolution': Where are we at with AI?

image.altText: A young man and an older man sit together in sporting stands

props.synopsis: The deal would see TikTok's American assets transferred from China's ByteDance to American owners.

title.children: Lachlan Murdoch involved in possible TikTok deal, Trump says

image.altText: Nicola Olyslagers holds up a Australia flag

props.synopsis: Nicola Olyslagers won a superb gold medal in a women's high jump that was twice suspended for torrential rain on the final day of the World Athletics Championships in Tokyo.

title.children: Olyslagers wins fantastic gold as rain hits final day

image.altText: Eleanor Patterson and Angelina Topic under an umbrella

props.synopsis: Eleanor Patterson did not come away with a medal at the 2025 World Athletics Championships. But by supporting Angelina TopiÄ though a tough moment, she gained so much more.

title.children: How this beautiful moment made up for missing a medal for Aussie star

image.altText: Large bottles of yellow cooking oil being filled at a factory.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of litres of used cooking oil is disposed of every year as a by-product of making some of Australia's favourite snacks, like chips â but one company is trialling a method to reduce waste.

title.children: Chip packaging made from recycled cooking oil in Australia-first trial

image.altText: A woman uses her phone outside an Optus store as a man looks at his.

props.synopsis: Optus reveals that in addition to customers in South Australia, Western Australia and the Northern Territory, two people in New South Wales were unable to connect to emergency services during the 13-hour outage last Thursday. Â

title.children: Optus triple-0 outage wider than first reported, CEO admits

image.altText: An adult hand cradles the feet of a baby.

props.synopsis: The race to advance gene editing tech continues, spurred on by starry-eyed Silicon Valley investors, entrepreneurs and even pronatalists. But it's still deeply controversial.

title.children: Gene editing could give us 'better' babies â but what are the ethical concerns?

image.altText: Three women in a gym, squatting while holding dumbbells. In between each woman is electrical tape marking physical distancing.

props.synopsis: Scientists have, for the first time, linked exercise with a particular protein in the blood that is associated with brain health.

title.children: Vigorous exercise can reduce risk of developing dementia, research shows

image.altText: An illustration of a measles particle.

props.synopsis: So far this year, there have been 121 measles notifications across Australiaâ the highest number since 2019, when there were 284 notifications.

title.children: Australia has been free of endemic measles since 2014, is that about to change?

image.altText: Eddie has grey hair and a blue top looks off screen, grey stubble, looks worried, flowers behind him.

props.synopsis: Victorian pensioner Eddie Rushforth says he does not know whether his bowel cancer has returned because he cannot afford the cost of the scans.

title.children: Pensioners say they are just 'waiting to die' as specialist costs rise

image.altText: A white jet flying at night over a city with lights on

props.synopsis: British fighter jets fly their first NATO air defence unit over Poland as part of a mission to bolster the Western alliance's defences following a Russian drone incursion this month.

title.children: UK fighter jets begin NATO air defence mission over Poland

image.altText: Donald Trump stands beneath a US flag billowing in a breeze

props.synopsis: The Trump administration saw an opportunity to crack down on liberal groups in the wake of the death of conservative activist Charlie Kirk. But not all conservatives are onboard.Â

title.children: Republicans divided in free speech quagmire after Charlie Kirk's death

image.altText: Oscar Piastri of Australia and McLaren climbs out of his damaged car

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri's worst weekend of 2025 ended with a false start, then a lap one crash, but he retains a healthy championship lead after his teammate failed to capitalise.Â

title.children: Piastri crashes out of F1 grand prix with 'silly' mistake on lap one

image.altText: Liberal MP Vincent Tarzia addresses the media.

props.synopsis: The SA opposition has promised to introduce 50 cent fares for all public transport, if elected in March next year.

title.children: SA opposition promises to slash public transport fares to 50 cents if elected

image.altText: A woman carries a bright green drink a a dish with fruit and a syringe with pistachio cream in it.

props.synopsis: Pistachios have become the food flavour of the season, and a lot of work goes into predicting what the next big thing will be.Â

title.children: 'We didn't know it was going to be as huge as it was': How pistachios become so popular

image.altText: A close up of Donald Trump holding a pen over an executive order he just signed

props.synopsis: The massive fee hike prompted a panicked reaction from big tech companies, but the US government says workers already on the visa won't be affected.Â

title.children: White House says new $100k H-1B visa fees won't apply to current workers

image.altText: Patrick Cripps kisses the Brownlow Medal on stage

props.synopsis: The AFL's big night is here, as the league's best and fairest player is honoured with the Brownlow Medal. Here is everything you need to know about the big event.

title.children: Brownlow Medal 2025: How to follow, how it works and who might win

image.altText: A man celebrates after scoring a try

props.synopsis: Canterbury is a team built in Penrith's image, but the Panthers served Canterbury a stark reminder that there can be only one.Â

title.children: How Penrith sent a chilling reminder that nobody does it like them

props.synopsis: In New York for the UN summit, Energy Minister Chris Bowen declines to offer a renewable energy target for 2035 after the Climate Change Authority projected more than 90 per cent would be needed to hit its recommended emissions target.

title.children: Government has not set 2035 renewables target, downplays 90pc

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair swept in a French twist smiles in warm lighting

props.synopsis: Away from the public eye, Katharine, the Duchess of Kent, was a trailblazer quietly changing lives.

title.children: The Duchess of Kent renounced her title in 2002 and never looked back

image.altText: A girl with dark hair and wearing a bright top does a peace sign while smiling

props.synopsis: Vassy dropped out of the contest at the last minute after coming under what Russian organisers said was "unprecedented political pressure from the government of Australia".

title.children: Australian singer drops out of Russian contest after 'political pressure'

image.altText: Anthony Albanese close up, with Chris Bowen in background.

props.synopsis: As Anthony Albanese touches down in New York ahead of the UN General Assembly, Republicans issue a warning against formally recognising Palestinian statehood.Â

title.children: Republicans warn PM of 'punitive measures' over Palestinian recognition

image.altText: Woman staring off to the side of the camera.

props.synopsis: Karenne Mosley was diagnosed with aggressive uterine cancer in March. She was booked in for surgery twice but is now in palliative care.

title.children: Former nurse 'extremely angry' after cancer deemed inoperable

image.altText: Man at the beach looks off into the distance. There is a jetty behind him.

props.synopsis: Experts are calling for new regulations on artificial intelligence chatbots, after a triple j hack investigation uncovered a disturbing example of a chatbot encouraging a man to murder his father while engaging in paedophilic role-play.Â

title.children: Australian man encouraged to murder his father by AI chatbot

image.altText: An old playground in an eerie plain with red dirt and dry grass.

props.synopsis: There's an eerie silence in Ninga Mia, a once thriving community on the edge of Kalgoorlie. The Aboriginal reserve is a microcosm of the cycle of displacement endured by many First Nations people.

title.children: How a forgotten village in the city of gold decayed into such squalor

image.altText: Paul Alamoti and Izack Tago celebrate

props.synopsis: Penrith has crushed Canterbury-Bankstown after a phenomenal first half to claim a 46-26 victory, keeping their hopes of a fifth-consecutive NRL premiership alive.

title.children: Penrith keep five-peat alive with dominant win over Bulldogs

image.altText: Dayne Zorko grabs at Mason Cox's eyewear.

props.synopsis: Brisbane Lions stalwart Dayne Zorko is punished by the AFL after he ripped off Mason Cox's glasses during their fiery preliminary final clash.

title.children: Lions veteran Zorko fined by AFL for targeting Cox's glasses

image.altText: A police officer with his back turned to the camera.

props.synopsis: Detectives from the Major Crime Division are investigating the death near a popular park in the Goldfields city early on Sunday morning.

title.children: Critically injured man dies after being found along Kalgoorlie street

image.altText: A fresh water crocodile looking at the camera while resting his chin

props.synopsis: It's crocodile breeding season and at one central Queensland farm, the drama is on par with a reality television dating show as keepers try to work out the best pairings.

title.children: 'You can start losing crocs': The high-risk game of crocodile matchmaking
